subject: libpldm : Add encode API for QueryDeviceIdentifiers cmd
commitMessage:
libpldm : Add encode API for QueryDeviceIdentifiers cmd

QueryDeviceIdentifiers command is used by update agent to obtain the
firmware identifiers for the fimrware device and its defined in DSP0267
Version 1.1.0 sec:10.1.

Tested: Unit tests passed

Signed-off-by: gokulsanker <gokul.sanker.v.g@intel.com>
Change-Id: I472e85414b1a04b550b88c3e6058b86efb9b89b1

Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 138cebab25bc1c861f1f932378f13201056b6a03 by Tom Joseph
The latest specification version is 1.1.0. Please check if there command request/response structures have undergone any change.
updated
nit: refactoring this isn't part of introducing QueryDeviceIdentifier command. We could move this particular commit out of the series.
Thanks, I was a bit confused as to why this change was relevant.
pushed another patch
Why is this header file included?
updated
These headers can be removed, if not necessary for this patch.
updated
tabs everywhere? is it intentional?

libpldm is formatted based on the Linux kernel coding guidelines.

https://github.com/openbmc/pldm/blob/master/libpldm/.clang-format
PLDM_FWUP
updated

libpldm/base.h
libpldm/firmware_update.h
updated
It can be introduced later, if there is a need.
updated
should this not be in a separate enum ? that captures all the commands that are related to firmware_update ?

+1

We can keep the convention of having enums for each PLDM type like 
https://github.com/openbmc/pldm/blob/master/libpldm/fru.h#L29
expand it to make it understandable .
Its just "in" in encode request right ?
The request data is encoded in the pldm_msg. Why should it be only [in]?
Duplicate Signed-off-by

1) Append PLDM_
2) Why have we taken the range starting with 0xF0?

I am in favor of adding separate error codes for encode/decode. We had discussed this in the PMCI WG, the only concern being that it will be messy to have some code use this and existing encode/decode using PLDM completion codes. We need to chalk out a plan to do that.
which contains
updated
type
type can be confusing since we have msg_type
encode_pldm_header_only or encode_only_pldm_header will make the intent clear.
updated

What is this parameter for?

In the case of encoding a response, bare minimum you have the completion code and you already have encode_cc_only_resp.
encode_pldm_header() is fucntion to create header part only , cmpletion code will be addded later from the calling fucntion

I see there is a challenge to get the right return code. This function is returning both PLDM base completion code as well as pldm_encode_decode_rc. My view is that this is going to create confusion and I suggest we separate the introduction of pldm_encode_decode_rc as a complete separate patch. We also need discussion to change the signature of the pack_pldm_header and unpack_pldm_header.
updated

As mentioned in the earlier patch. Put the commands for PLDM FW update commands in an enumeration.

https://github.com/openbmc/pldm/blob/master/libpldm/fru.h#L27
updated
pldm_encode_decode_rc
moved out of this patch
Why is the range 0xF0-0xF4 selected for this?

Gokul, this patch is doing much more that it should. To allow for faster merges, we can separate this specific change (introducing different error codes for encode/decode success) and push after this series is over.
+1, that will help to merge this quicker.
updated
Typically @param[in] goes first followed by @param[in,out] and @param[out].
updated
